summary:

body: Nature, Published online: 07 January 2026; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09856-5 Yakut communities, with Trans-Baikal admixture during the Mongol expansion, preserved genomic diversity and oral microbiomes despite the Russian conquest, which introduced cereals, pathogens and Christianity, whereas marital practices preserved low consanguinity except in one late case of traditional shamanism.

body: Nature, Published online: 07 January 2026; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09908-w The anterior cingulate cortex encodes affective pain behaviours modulated by opioids; targeting opioid-sensitive neurons through a new chemogenetic gene therapy replicates the analgesic effects of morphine, providing precise chronic pain relief without affecting sensory detection.

title: A way to identify the biological basis of gene–trait associations
summary:
Nature, Published online: 07 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-04004-5

Genetic-association studies have identified many genetic variants that are associated with complex traits. However, in most cases, the biology underlying …
body: Nature, Published online: 07 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-04004-5 Genetic-association studies have identified many genetic variants that are associated with complex traits. However, in most cases, the biology underlying the association is unknown. Integrating experimental gene-perturbation and genetic-association data sets could reveal the mechanisms underlying complex traits.
